title: Foorigin: The Future of Food Chain
description: The food served in restaurants can be expensive and unhealthy. Adulteration, wastage and profit prioritization exists in the supply chain.

f6_assessments.q0:
Using an immutable blockchain to store data on the food chain is a great idea. It is not as simple as just building an app to commit the data to the blockchain. Who are the users? What is the data you are collecting, how are you collecting it, how are you ensuring data integrity before it is published to the blockchain how are you going to display it. 
It would be good to have a more concrete minimum viable product. For instance choose one food chain and outline how you are going to collect the data and how this data solves a specific problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers appear to have relevant experience on the programming side. However there is a lot more to a successful project here. From my experience in the prop-tech and robotics space, physical collection of the data and provision is a useful end product of that data is a key component they have skimmed over. The proposers should produce a plan for a specific use case and show how they will robustly, efficiently collect untampered data and publish it to the block chain. They should also then produce analysis with this data that their end user would value. A plan to produce this minimum Viable product would be something that could then be evaluated and would make this project more likely.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no clear plan on exactly what is going to be done, who the end users are, or what success looks like.  A detailed plan in a specific use case should be developed and then metrics against that can be measured. Maybe that is food waste avoided, costs saved, margin increase through proof of organic supply? Currently the idea is too broad.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your suggestions and comments. Given the short timeframe in which we have put the team together, we hope our Summit video can be considered for rating purposes. Indeed, the proposal on ideascale did not have relevant info on the roadmap, but we would like to point to our Summit video that has the clear plan and ROI success metrics: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H6tCK3PUeAHvnTCjGn_iu-10lCivsYgh/view?usp=sharing . Apologies for not having provided this earlier.

f6_assessments.q0: Food traceability has become big business in the distribution sector as it has become more and more regulated. Creating a tracker on chain and supplying it to a DApp through the use of metadata could open up this sector to the blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience by the team is relevant. There is even the option to integrate AI at a later stage. Ties to Gimbalabs provide an assurance that there is guidance in developing this project. One thing that I'm still left with is how this would get advertised to restaurants and producers. What incentive would there be to implement this tracker into their system and not the one that they're already using?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal contains ample information about the general plan that is prospected. There is a clear and realistic trimestrial roadmap set. However, the fund is very modest to develop something like this. Are you sure it can be done with this amount? How would the DApp get marketed? What would happen if there isn't enough adoption?

f6_assessments.q0: How would you get mass adoption? How does your software application help to make food healthy or more affordable? How does your application implement into the Cardano Ecosystem and thrive together using transactional metadata to solve a specific aspect of a problem.
f6_assessments.q1: I feel like so many industry around the globe need more accountability measures for proof of origin in the supply chain. However after spending 25 years in very high end Hotels I feel like this needs a bigger payout. What problems could your application specifically solve and list these. How will you carry out the implication of going to market. What is your budget? will you need additional funds to get this done? Detailed plan of attack.
f6_assessments.q2: All proposals are competing for the same small amounts so the ones that will be most successful will have a very clear road map of exactly how success would look. The voter would want see more transparency in your proposal to allocate funds to a project.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your suggestions and comments. Indeed, we are to blame for not including a clear roadmap in the F6 proposal. We are just requesting the initial seed fund and of course we have plans to get VC funding and register companies in Singapore/India. Given the short timeframe in which we have put the team together, we hope our Summit video can be considered for rating purposes. However, we hope that the ROI success metrics and much clearer presentation for the Summit video makes up for it: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H6tCK3PUeAHvnTCjGn_iu-10lCivsYgh/view?usp=sharing

f6_assessments.q0: A great idea for a proposal. It gives a good vision on a problem in the food industry and makes good use of metadata. It fits will within the challenge settings. I do however feel like it's missing a good connecting to the system, I'm missing where it will provide sustainability to the system. Would the proposal not get funded in this funding adding more clarity on this would make it a better proposal for the next funding.
f6_assessments.q1: The description of the proposal gives a clear outline of what it plans to do and how they want to handle the proposal. The proposers are well known with the eco-system and are om touch with other proposals for possible collaborations. The summary of the budget is great although I do think it might be a bit under budget for the total of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The given roadmap is clear and within a reasonable timeframe. However, the proposer doesn't present a clear vision of success or how they plan to address challenges on the roadmap. I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

solution: A supply chain tracker for vendors, cloud kitchens and restaurants to trace the burger back to the farm using mobile apps & off-chain data.
experience: Team consisting of Plutus and app developers with experience in AI, Machine learning, IoT, Flutter, React, Solidity, Kotlin & Node.js.
